intro: Halgania cyanea var. preissiana, commonly known as the blue halgania, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often with a slight pubescence. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
